data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word وَلَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to pull down, demolish, break (contract), undo a thing, violate (treaty), unravel/untwist.
data.sentence: The word يَنْقُضُونَ comes from the root ن ق ض and is associated with the meanings: to pull down, demolish, break (contract), undo a thing, violate (treaty), unravel/untwist.

data.meanings: to enjoin/charge/impose/swear. ahdun - treaty/covenant/promise/agreement/compact/oath, bond, condition, bequest, responsibility, guarantee, time, epoch, acquaintance, true, friendship, affection, security.
data.sentence: The word بِعَهْدِ comes from the root ع ه د and is associated with the meanings: to enjoin/charge/impose/swear. ahdun - treaty/covenant/promise/agreement/compact/oath, bond, condition, bequest, responsibility, guarantee, time, epoch, acquaintance, true, friendship, affection, security.

data.meanings: to reach the end, keep ones promise, fulfil ones engagement, pay a debt, perform a promise. tawaffa - to die. wafaat - death.
data.sentence: The word يُوفُونَ comes from the root و ف ي and is associated with the meanings: to reach the end, keep ones promise, fulfil ones engagement, pay a debt, perform a promise. tawaffa - to die. wafaat - death.

data.meanings: to place trust in any one, rely upon, bind.
data.sentence: The word الْمِيثَاقَ comes from the root و ث ق and is associated with the meanings: to place trust in any one, rely upon, bind.
